Description: Body sherd of Attic pottery cup, probably a lip-cup; interior glazed black (fired streaky brown); exterior: reserved handle zone; black lower body; inscription in handle zone.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.11)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 851, pl. XXII, no. 851)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 417, no. B648)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0583) (Phase 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 692, no. 500)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234, no. 21)
